chargeHist.descr: Deliver Heroin within 1000 feet of park-2nd or subsequent offense  (<3g)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Cheree M. HEITZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Jennifer Diaz unless approved by agent.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
The State moves to delete the enhancers in count 1.  Court grants the motion.
GUILTY plea entered to the amended charge of deliver heroin in count 1. Convicted.
GUILTY plea entered to count 5, felony bail jumping.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 2, 3, 4 and 6.  Motion granted.
The Court orders a Presentence Investigation Report to be completed by the Department of Corrections.
PSI is due on 06-23-16.
Sentencing is set for 06-30-16 at 10:30 a.m.
The Court orders defendant to submit to DNA sample.
Minutes.
Notice of Bail Bond forfeiture returned from both Pamela Baker and Cheree M. Heitz "insufficient address".
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for a plea date on 05-05-16 at 11:45 a.m.  $500.00 cash bail previously furnished is to be forfeited.  Bail is set at $3,000.00 cash bail.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Warrant returned with service of officer
